meanings.definition: A person, typically a professional combatant, who fought in ancient Rome as a public spectacle.
meanings.sent1: The gladiators entered the arena with their swords ready.
meanings.sent2: The gladiators battled fiercely in the colosseum.
meanings.sent3: The gladiators decided to have a friendly competition to entertain the crowd.
meanings.sent4: In the business world, the gladiators of marketing fight for consumer attention.
meanings.sent5: The image of the gladiators fighting in the arena stayed in the spectators' minds for days.

meanings.definition: A person who engages in a fight or competition.
meanings.sent1: During the game, the gladiators showed great sportsmanship.
meanings.sent2: The gladiators competed fiercely for the championship title.
meanings.sent3: The gladiators decided to settle their argument through a friendly match.
meanings.sent4: In the world of politics, the gladiators of debate clash over important issues.
meanings.sent5: The gladiators' determination to win was evident in every move they made.
